channel.title: World News, News of World, Top World News, World Breaking Headlines - Times of India
channel.description: TOI delivers the Top Latest World news and Headlines from US, UK, Gulf, Pakistan, China, Europe and rest of the world.

image.title: World News, News of World, Top World News, World Breaking Headlines - Times of India

item.title: Brazil police sentenced for 1992 prison 'massacre'
item.description: Twenty-three Brazilian police officers were sentenced to 156 years in jail each today for their role in the killing of 111 inmates during Brazil's deadliest prison uprising in 1992.

item.title: US pushes Turkey-Israel reconciliation
item.description: Kerry said he believes that Davutoglu and Turkey's prime minister, Recep Tayyip Erdogan "are deeply committed to fulfilling all of the obligations of that understanding.

item.title: Protesters in final bid to block France gay marriage law
item.description: Thousands of opponents of a gay marriage bill thronged the streets of Paris on Sunday in a last-ditch bid to block the legislation, under the watchful eye of police after recent violence.

item.title: Huge protest in France against gay marriage law
item.description: Thousands of opponents of a gay marriage bill thronged the streets of Paris on Sunday in a last-ditch bid to block the legislation, under the watchful eye of police after recent violence.

item.title: Pope, worried about Venezuela, urges dialogue
item.description: The first pope from South America says he is worried about Venezuela and is urging politicians there to use dialogue and work for reconciliation.

item.title: Bomb kills 4 Pak soldiers near Afghan border
item.description: A roadside bomb targeting a military convoy on Sunday killed four Pakistan army soldiers and wounded four more in a northwestern tribal area near the Afghan border, officials said.

item.title: Mayor wounded, two dead in Philippine ambush
item.description: Communist guerrillas have wounded a town mayor and killed two of her aides in a pre-election ambush in the southern Philippines, police said on Sunday.

item.title: Iraq counts votes from first polls since US pullout
item.description: Election officials began tallying votes on Sunday from Iraq's first elections since US troops departed, a contest that served as a key test of its stability amid a spike in violence.

item.title: Japanese minister visits war shrine
item.description: A Japanese minister visited Tokyo's controversial Yasukuni war shrine on Sunday while Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has dedicated equipment used in rituals in moves likely to anger China and South Korea.

item.title: China rushes relief after Sichuan quake kills 180
item.description: Rescuers and relief teams struggled to rush supplies into the rural hills of China's Sichuan province Sunday after an earthquake left at least 180 people dead and more than 11,000 injured and prompted frightened survivors to spend a night in cars, tents and makeshift shelters.

item.title: China earthquake toll rises to 164, injuries at 6,700
item.description: Rescuers poured into a remote corner of southwestern China on Sunday as the death toll from the country's worst earthquake in three years climbed to 164 with more than 6,700 injured, state media said.

item.title: 12 held hostage in Brazil prison mutiny: Reports
item.description: Three inmates seized 12 people hostage Saturday during a prison mutiny in central Brazil, media reports said.

item.title: Boston lost $1 billion in day-long lockdown
item.description: As Boston shut down during a day-long manhunt for a suspect in the marathon bombing that culminated on Friday, another cost was added to the human and emotional toll: lost business.

item.title: 7-magnitude quake rocks China, kills 158
item.description: A 7.0-magnitude earthquake caused widespread destruction in southwest China’s Sichuan province on Saturday with the official death toll creeping towards 160 until midnight.

item.title: Pervez Musharraf sent on two-week remand
item.description: An anti-terrorism court on Saturday extended former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf’s detention remanding him in judicial custody for two weeks in a case accusing him of illegally detaining judges after imposing emergency in the country in 2007.

item.title: Security breach at Maduro’s swearing-in
item.description: The six-day old drama around Nicolas Maudro's election as Venezuela's president took a nasty turn on Friday, when he was pushed from the microphone as he delivered his inaugural address.

item.title: Napolitano re-elected Italy's president
item.description: Italy's Parliament re-elected Giorgio Napolitano as the nation's president to an unprecedented second term after party leaders persuaded the aging head of state to serve again in hopes of easing the hostile political climate that has thwarted formation of a new government for the economically stagnant eurozone member.

item.title: China earthquake death toll reaches 160
item.description: Residents huddled outdoors Saturday night in a town near the epicenter of a powerful earthquake that struck the steep hills of China's southwestern Sichuan province, leaving at least 160 people dead and more than 6,700 injured.

item.title: China earthquake death toll reaches 157
item.description: The shallow earthquake struck Sichuan province prompting a major rescue operation in the same area where 87,000 people were reported dead or missing in a quake in 2008.

item.title: Egypt's Morsi to announce cabinet reshuffle
item.description: Egypt's Islamist President Mohamed Morsi is set to announce a cabinet reshuffle, a presidential aide said on Saturday, but it is unlikely to meet opposition demands for a complete overhaul of the government.

item.title: Prince Harry to race to South Pole
item.description: Prince Harry will take part in a race to the South Pole as member of a team of wounded British servicemen and women, a media report said.

item.title: Italy's president agrees to another term if picked
item.description: With a heavily polarized Parliament unable so far to agree on a new president for Italy, 87-year-old President Giorgio Napolitano yielded on Saturday to pleading from political leaders to be a candidate for a second term and quickly end an impasse which has thwarted efforts to form a government in the recession-mired country.

item.title: Heavy clashes near Syria-Lebanese border
item.description: Syrian troops backed by pro-government gunmen fought fierce battles with rebels on Saturday in a strategic area in Homs province near the Lebanese border, activists and state media in Damascus reported.

item.title: Dozens killed in battle near Damascus
item.description: Syrian troops backed by pro-government gunmen fought fierce battles with rebels on Saturday in a strategic area in Homs province near the Lebanese border, activists and state media in Damascus reported.

item.title: Musharraf sent to judicial custody
item.description: Facing treason charges, former Pakistani military ruler Pervez Musharraf today appeared before an anti-terrorism court here which sent him to 14-day judicial custody but instead of jail he will be detained at his sprawling farmhouse which has been declared a sub-jail.
